availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Smith (Woodford County, Kentucky, cabinet maker and provisional government convention member)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Filed a marriage bond to Pamelia Duvall Smith in Woodford County, Kentucky, on December 14, 1835. Father of Sidney Smith, George W. Smith, James H. Smith, Jesse Smith, Matilda Smith, Ann E. Smith, Philip Smith, Lucretia Smith, Margaret Smith, John H. Smith, and McClellan Smith. Farmer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Woodford County in 1850. Farmer in Woodford County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 484B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District No. 2, p. 5.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 896.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 5, p. 518A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252329, p. 241.
